p: Methanol and chloroform extracts of O. europea leaves had anti-inflammatory effects in vivo in the paw edema test in rats [ 85]. Omer et al. examined in vivo toxicity, feeding rats up to 0.9% olive leaf extract in diet for Wistar albino rats for 6 weeks; they found hepatocellular and renal abnormalities, lower cholesterol and blood glucose, and no fatality [ 86]. Amabeoku et al. tested orally administered methanol leaf extract for acute toxicity in mice, and found an LD 50 of 3475 mg/kg [ 87].
